PATIENT_ID: TEST_TRAUMATIC_ARREST_001
ARRIVAL_TIME: 2026-02-06 01:00:00

[TRAUMA_HP] 2026-02-06 01:05:00
Category I activation for 35-year-old male. Traumatic cardiac arrest.
Pedestrian struck by vehicle at high speed. Blunt trauma mechanism.
Cardiac arrest at scene. No pulse on EMS arrival.
Signs of life: organized cardiac electrical activity on initial rhythm check.
Patient had agonal respirations in field per EMS.
BP unattainable. No palpable pulse.

[NURSING_NOTE] 2026-02-06 01:08:00
CPR ongoing. Cardiac rhythm monitored: PEA on arrival.
Monitor data obtained. Cardiac rhythm documented.
Bilateral pleural decompression performed. No improvement.
Trauma-directed resuscitation initiated per protocol.

[PHYSICIAN_NOTE] 2026-02-06 01:15:00
Mechanism of injury: blunt pedestrian-vs-auto at estimated 45 mph.
Signs of life present in field per EMS. Organized cardiac activity noted.
Interventions: bilateral chest decompression, pelvic binder,
massive transfusion. ROSC achieved at 12 minutes.
